headline: Chicken Stir-Fry
description: This chicken stir-fry recipe is quick and easy to make with any vegetable you like! Fresh ginger, garlic, and red pepper flakes add a kick of heat.

video.name: How to Make Chicken Stir Fry

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
recipeIngredient: 3 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, thinly sliced
1 (8 ounce) can sliced water chestnuts, drained
1 green bell pepper, cut into matchsticks

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender, and liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch in a medium glass or ceramic bowl; stir until smooth. Stir in ginger, garlic, and red pepper flakes; add chicken and stir to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes.

Heat 1 tablespoon sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add broccoli, onion, carrots, water chestnuts, and bell pepper; cook and stir until just tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer vegetables into a dish; set aside.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil in the same wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken, reserving marinade, and cook until just browned, about 2 minutes per side; stir in vegetables and reserved marinade. Bring to a boil; cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center and vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Serve over rice.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make and taste great!
I made this recipe as written. The next day I added shrimp to the leftovers, and still very delicious. This recipe is a keeper💗
This was a quick easy stir fry. Tasted great. Probably should use low sodium soy sauce - a little salty. But I will definitely make this again.
Delicous
It was so tasty. I loved it. I will be making it regularly. It needed no changes, although I used chicken thighs because that’s what I had on hand.
Made this for my wife she absolutely loved it and so did i so simple to make and very tasty this is going to be a regular dish in our house.
Very Very Good !!!!

This was a huge it, even with my picky kids! (They picked out the vegetables of course.) I used powdered ginger and garlic powder instead of minced, and I omitted the red pepper flakes. I used a red bell pepper instead of green, and added snow peas. Delicious! Will make again and again!!
Excellent stir fry! The sauce is always the key to stir fries and this sauce was just right! Added mushrooms and peanuts.
Great recipe. Easy to make. I made is exactly as the recipe stated. I didn’t find it too spicy. Next time I make this I will increase the red pepper flakes and there will definitely be a next time.

I made this without any changes to the recipe and highly recommend it! I will also be versatile recipe to change (different types of vegetables, thinly sliced pork instead of chicken). The sauce is delicious. I don't understand the complaint about it being too spicy... just reduce or eliminate the red pepper flakes!
Too spicy and ruined the taste.

Holy moly this is OUTSTANDING!! This was so flipping good my daughter who never touches vegetables ate the veggies, lol!! This is better than anything I've had at a restaurant and it's quick! Perfect for weeknight dinners or for guests. WOW!!
Loved it! Made it tonight and my 12 yr old is gobbling it down. We both really enjoyed it. It was easy to make.
Great! Easy and fast. Halved easily for smaller portions. Used rice noodles instead of rice for preference.
Good! I like a slightly sweeter sauce, so will add a bit more sugar next time
Family favorite in our house, make it exactly as recipe says and it’s delicious and easy!
Easy to make and had it with udon noodles instead of rice.
Easy and delish even without ginger!!
I enjoyed this. Will definitely use low salt soy sauce next time. I added fresh mushrooms to mine.
Quick and easy. So good my husband even enjoyed it!

Quick and dirty. Sesame oil is intended to finish, not to cook (think using EVOO instead of good old olive oil) so I used canola for my frying and then tossed the finished product in toasted sesame oil. Next time I'll be cutting the sugar in half.

Wow, this is amazing! I had extra time today, so I marinated the chicken for about 6 hours and the flavor of the chicken is beyond flavorful! Very easy to make since I used frozen stir fry vegetables and added water chestnuts and mini corn... so delicious!
Very easy to make and was very good. Very flavorful and visually appealing with the bright colors of the various vegetables.

This is a quick, easy and delicious way to use any leftover vegetables you may have in your fridge. I added mushrooms and it just makes it that much better! Thank you for sharing this recipe! My entire family loves it and demolishes it every time I make it
Super easy and delicious!!
It was easy to make and has good flavor.

This turned out delicious! I made it exactly as the recipe except I halved the sugar (just because I like things less sweet). I also left out the water chestnuts and added mushrooms. I liked that it made enough marinade to keep the stir fry saucy and not too dry.
I loved it. I will make some changes next time like add in mushrooms and green beans but it was a hit
Much too sweet. Did not enjoy it at all.
I did not care for the bitter sauce I had. Could it have been my soy sauce?
Too salty :'(
Delicious!!!
Used beef and came out perfect

Couldn’t find any water chestnuts at our local store. Had a can of bean sprouts and used those instead. Wife doesn’t like red pepper so I left that out. Otherwise no changes really, except how I cut the carrots. Liked it very much. Will be saving some of the reserved marinade and make it again soon.
This was a very delicious and satisfying dish everyone 13 people right off the bat are even more impressed its great
I mixed together everything this recipe 😋 is awesome, off the wall, I will make this again over and over, thank you so much ❤
This is such a great recipe!

Delicious! We made it with the veggies we had on hand — bok Choy, broccoli, onion, yellow bell pepper, carrot, green onion. I would add a bit of salt and pepper while stir-frying, and it’s great with some sriracha or other chili in addition to the red pepper flakes. Served it with white rice.
Excellent recipe!! Turned out awesome! I'll definitely be making it again!
I improvised w/ ingredients I have and turned out delicious! I recommend.

This was a super delicious recipe! I made a couple of changes based on our likes/dislikes but I don’t usually follow recipes exactly as written. I used chicken thighs and instead of water chestnuts I used bamboo shoots. I also did not use all the soy it called for and added a hint of teriyaki sauce. I am giving this 5 stars and will definitely be adding this to our weekend dinner rotation!
The marinade/sauce is yummy. I used vegies that I had at home (celery, onion, carrots, green beans). Served on riced cauliflower. Delicious.
This marinade made this dish. It could make many dishes taste amazing.
It was a hit with my family

This is a great recipe! You can easily make it your own by changing the the vegs or the protein, always turns out yummy. That's my kind of recipe...since, it's hard for me to follow recipes to the letter. :)

Per other comments, I was wary about this dish being salty. Consequently, I used 1/3 cup soy sauce and 1/3 cup reduced-sodium soy sauce to make the marinade. I marinated the cubed chicken in a plastic bag, draining it well before cooking the meat. When I returned the vegetables to the cooked chicken in my wok, I used about 1/2 of the reserved sauce. Also, while reheating the veggies with the chicken, rather than add more of the marinade, I put in about 1/4 cup of orange juice. Hubby really liked this served with white rice. I will make it again, keeping in mind the need to use reduced-sodium soy sauce.
Exactly what I was looking for in a quick easy meal, plenty of flavor, and my daughter loves it now
It was easy and delicious

I liked this, but found it quite sweet. I will probably lessen the brown sugar next time! I did add some white pepper, a splash of vegetarian oyster sauce and used a bit of dark soya sauce with the 2/3 cup low sodium soya in thhe marinade. I would definitely make again, and let the chicken marinade longer! I also used 3 chicken breasts and frozen stir fry vegetables because I didn't have time to run out today. Thank you for sharing such a great recipe! I will definitely use this as a base!
Easy to make and delicious! My kids love it!
The sauce is delicious, sweet, and just a bit spicy. My family loved this dish.
Didn't use the water chestnuts as the majority of the family ate not big fans of that vegetable, but otherwise it was delicious
Delicious. Cut soy sauce to 1/2 cup of low sodium.
This was pretty good and not salty at all. I followed the recipe exactly and my family really liked it. .
This was so awesome and I didnt change a thing. I did add some snow peas just because I had some but it was so delicious. The whole family loved it and I will make it again! :)

It was good and easy to make. I used precut chicken breasts. I didn't have any sesame oil so I used olive oil instead. 
To make the sauce, I followed the directions but used powdered ginger instead of fresh. I did add 1 TBS hoisin sauce to give it more flavor.
I used frozen stir fry vegetables that included Italian green beans, carrots, water chestnuts, corn, red peppers, and broccoli. I served it over Jasmine rice.
Made this recipe and know I can make chicken stir fry

I made this for dinner tonight with leftover dark meat chicken. I needed to add a little more liquid to the stir fry, so I added chicken stock. It was absolutely delicious! I will definitely make it again.
Smells amazing, tastes just as amazing.
Very good! I used a rotisserie chicken (already cooked). Very tender and cut cooking time. Marinated the same way and it was delicious.

Other than skipping the water chestnuts because our family doesn't like them, I followed the directions exactly as written. It was delicious. The kids liked it. It wasn't too spicy or too salty. It also made enough sauce to cover our rice the way we like. This recipe is a keeper.
Super easy first time was a hit! Will definitely be a family favourite
Reduced the soy sauce to 1/4 cup and did not use brown sugar. Was very good.
I loved it! Made it exactly the way the recipe says too. I added shrimp but I felt like the chicken came out so much better! Love this recipe!
Very tasty! Easy & quick. I used frozen broccoli stir fry. Increased corn starch a little per reviews! Will make again!
Also, if you're sensitive to salt, don't use full strength soy. I used low sodium salt, and it turned out great.
Way too salty!! I like the other flavours but I would probably only use 1/4 cup soy sauce or less with some water.
Quick, easy and a family favorite! We use white rice AND lo mein noodles.
Easy
i thought this was a great recipe and so easy our family loved it

I made this recipe exactly as written. I'm not sure if it's because I used China lily as my soy sauce or what but this was way too salty and sweet for us. I mean, my kids loved it of course but it was way too salty for me. Next time I'll use less soy sauce and less brown sugar. Otherwise this was very yummy and I'll definitely make it again.

Having to cook gluten free for 1 in household is tough sometimes, so I was able to improvise, but kept everyone happy! Cut back on ginger and prepared chicken completely separate in the sauce. Was still slightly salty, but what Chinese restaurant isn’t! Used red& green peppers, onion, carrots, mushrooms, pea pods and garlic.
Reduced the ginger, and used less sodium soy sauce. Just seemed like too much. Still tasted delicious.

Love this recipe!! Have been making this for 4 years now!! I know it by heart! Sometimes I do ramen noodles, rice, or with bone in chicken thighs baked in the oven with the sauce. Ughh it’s amazing. I usually skip the ginger. Try it out!! The attached picture I didn’t use rice or noodles so it was low carb. I’m mostly here for the sauce hehe

Very tasty! I was glad that I read another review that questioned the amount of soy sauce. I put 1/3 of a cup of full strength soy sauce and that was plenty for us! Just like many other people, this is going to be a go to recipe for me!
I use cabbage instead of broccoli
Nice light meal. Added zucchini just because we like it. (Left out bell peppers) Has become a go to meal.
Love
This recipe was DELICIOUS! I would definitely make this again!

I made this taking a shortcut - bought precut stir fry vegetables in produce section of my grocery store. Then prepared as directed. We loved it - My husband is not always a fan of stir fry but he really liked it. Will definitely make it again.

I love this recipe. No need to marinade the chicken though. I cooked the chicken and then tossed in the vegetables and sauce mixture and it turned out fabulous! Whole family approves which is hard to do in my house. :D
The only thing I didn't do was the rice was too late but it came out great

Great recipe! Very easy to make and use the vegetables you have. I had cooked chicken already so did not marinate it but was able to adapt recipe easily to use. I did as some suggested and reduced the soy sauce used to 1/2 cup and used reduced sodium soy. Next time I would add even less soy as it was still a bit salty for our liking. My picky daughter liked it as well!
Family loved it!!
Delicious. I have made this recipe several times, and the nice thing is that you can use any veggies you like/have on hand. Otherwise, this recipe does not need any modifications.

Very good recipe. I too had frozen california mix veggies that I used in addition to the bell pepper and onion. I had to use powdered ginger instead of fresh but it worked out well. My wife and I enjoyed it very much. Thanks for sharing this, it will be my go to stir fry recipe.
amazing. will definately make this again and again

Great starter Stir Fry recipe. Optionally you can add Bamboo Shoots, Mushrooms, even Peanuts. Be sure to use low sodium soy sauce and when adding the remainder of the marinade at the end, use it like you would salt.. (Season to taste just, don't dump it all at once and then complain it's too salty)!

I make this 2-3 times a month now, and everyone loves it! Even my picky niece (she's 6) eats this and asks for more! 

As far as the recommended ingredients, I use them all, and throw whatever else I have in the fridge: bok choy, extra broccoli, baby corn, fresh water chestnuts, bamboo shoots, and the occasional mushroom as well - yum. 

Also, I almost always end up with WAY more than 6 servings. This one improves with age, by the way - I mean, it's always tastier the second day.

One thing I learned from experience: I tend to double the corn starch (I like a thicker sauce), fry the veggies first and let the moisture drain from them, then, I fry the meat and onions, to control the amount the sauce is diluted. When finished, I put the veggies back in, with the marinade, then add back veggie liquid to desired consistency.
I used the veggies that we had left over in the fridge. I think the sauce was too much so next time, I will not pour as much in the wok.

Followed suggestions in review by SweetsRGood and we really loved it. For the sweet & sour sauce, I used Frank's Chili sauce (the pink one) and omitted the red pepper flakes. I used a pork tenderloin instead of chicken. This was really great!!
It was delicious! Will definitely make again!

Perfect stir fry—my family loved it. I used the veggies I had: mushrooms, green beans, onion, zucchini. I steamed the green beans before adding them to make sure they were the right amount done, because I used tons of green beans.
Amazing

GREAT recipe! I wanted to try something different from my typical chicken stir fry recipe, and the family loved this version! Since I sometimes am delayed in starting dinner, I have decided that next time I make this recipe (and I'm positive I will) I will chop the vegetables and prepare the chicken earlier in the day and have them ready, and perhaps even make the sauce in advance as well. Doing so would make putting this recipe together unbelievably easy.

Waaaaay too salty!!!!! I don't understand how anyone gave this 5 stars or even why it is listed on this site. We almost couldn't eat it. I added water to the final mix of vegetables and chicken to make it barely palatable.
Omitted the water chestnuts as I don't care for them and added sprouts. Really easy and very tasty.
Super tasty
